Actually, a -dev package is the stuff needed to develop applications using a particular library.  The plain package like 'tcl' is just run-time support for using a library.  The -dev like 'tcl-dev' is for creating apps using tcl.
You can see what a package is using 'apt-cache show packagename'
packagename was a placeholder where you put the package name that you care about.  'apt-cache show tcl'
I missed the start of your question.  I was just helping with 'what are all these packages?'
You need 'sudo apt-get build-dep lm-sensors' .  That takes advantage of the list of build dependencies in the lm-sensors package.
Or you could just install the prebuild lm-sensors package.
That command will install the packages that are recorded as dependencies to build the lm-sensors package from source.
